alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Henry, west central Des Moines, southeastern Van Buren and northwestern Lee Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms with heavy rain along a line extending from near West Burlington to near Keosauqua. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches per hour can be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roads, especially in urban areas can be expected. Thunderstorms will be near... West Burlington, Danville and Middletown around 200 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Van Buren
